text: Every day approximately 8 million pieces of plastic pollution find their way into our oceans. 12 million tonnes of plastic are poured into the ocean every year.
Air pollution kills 800 people every hour or 13 every minute - more than three times compared to malaria, tuberculosis and AIDS combined each year.
Thousands of chemicals from cleaning products are washed into streams and rivers. Some persist in the environment and enter the food chain.
In the past 50 years, humans have consumed more resources than in all previous history.
